oxford: A round fruit with shiny red or green skin that is fairly hard and white inside.
cambridge: A round fruit with firm, white flesh and a green, red, or yellow skin.
macmilan: A hard round fruit that is white inside and has a smooth green, yellow, or red skin, which is called peel when it has been removed. The middle part of the apple containing the seeds is called the core. Apples grow on apple trees.
collins: An apple is a round fruit with smooth green, yellow, or red skin and firm white flesh.
longman: A hard round fruit that has red, light green, or yellow skin and is white inside.
merriam-webster: the fleshy, usually rounded red, yellow, or green edible pome fruit of a usually cultivated tree of the rose family.
wiktionary: A common, round fruit produced by the tree Malus domestica, cultivated in temperate climates.
wikipedia: An apple is an edible fruit produced by an apple tree.

oxford: A long curved fruit with a thick yellow skin and that is soft inside, which grows on trees in hot countries.
cambridge: A long, curved fruit with a yellow skin and soft, sweet, white flesh inside.
macmilan: a long curved fruit with a yellow skin
collins: A long curved fruit with yellow skins.
longman: a long curved tropical fruit with a yellow skin.
merriam-webster: an elongated usually tapering tropical fruit with soft pulpy flesh enclosed in a soft usually yellow rind.
wiktionary: An elongated curved tropical fruit that grows in bunches and has a creamy flesh and a smooth skin.
wikipedia: an elongated, edible fruit produced by several kinds of large herbaceous flowering plants in the genus Musa.

oxford: A round citrus fruit with thick skin of a colour between red and yellow and a lot of sweet juice.
cambridge: A round, sweet fruit with a thick skin and a centre that has many parts.
macmilan: A small green or purple fruit that grows in bunches on a vine, often used for making wine.
collins: An orange is a round juicy fruit with a thick, orange coloured skin.
longman: A round fruit that has a thick orange skin and is divided into parts inside.
merriam-webster: a globose berry with a yellowish to reddish-orange rind and a sweet edible pulp.
wiktionary: The fruit of the orange tree a citrus fruit with a slightly sour flavour.
wikipedia: The orange is the fruit of various citrus species in the family Rutaceae.

oxford: A soft red fruit with very small yellow seeds on the surface, that grows on a low plant.
cambridge: A small, red fruit with small, brown seeds on its surface.
macmilan: A small soft red fruit with a lot of very small seeds on its skin.
collins: A strawberry is a small red fruit which is soft and juicy and has tiny yellow seeds on its skin.
longman: A soft red juicy fruit with small seeds on its surface, or the plant that grows this fruit.
merriam-webster: The juicy edible usually red fruit of any of several low-growing temperate herbs of the rose family that is technically an enlarged pulpy receptacle bearing numerous achenes on its surface.
wiktionary: The sweet, usually red, edible fruit of certain plants of the genus Fragaria.
wikipedia: The garden strawberry is a widely grown hybrid species of the genus Fragaria, collectively known as the strawberries, which are cultivated worldwide for their fruit.

oxford: A small green or purple fruit that grows in bunches on a climbing plant.
cambridge: A small, round, purple or pale green fruit that you can eat or make into wine.
macmilan: A small green or purple fruit that grows in bunches on a vine, often used for making wine.
collins: A small, round, purple or pale green fruit that you can eat or make into wine.
longman: One of a number of small round green or purple fruits that grow together on a vine. Grapes are often used for making wine.
merriam-webster: A smooth-skinned juicy light green or deep red to purplish black berry eaten dried or fresh as a fruit or fermented to produce wine
wiktionary: A small, round, smooth-skinned edible fruit, usually purple, red, or green, that grows in bunches on vines of genus Vitis.
wikipedia: A grape is a fruit, botanically a berry, of the deciduous woody vines of the flowering plant genus Vitis.
test1_human: Genus of about 60 to 80 species of vining plants in the family Vitaceae, native to the north temperate zone, including varieties that may be eaten as table fruit, dried to produce raisins, or crushed to make grape juice or wine.
test2_human: Fleshy, rounded fruits that grow in clusters made up of many fruits of greenish, yellowish or purple skin
test3_human: The pulp is juicy and sweet, and it contain several seeds or pips.
test4_human: It is a well-known fruit; it is eaten raw, although it is mainly used for making wine.
